intro: Cyrtandra × villosula, commonly known as the hairy Cyrtandra, is a hybrid plant in the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Pacific, including Hawaii and parts of Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, often glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by horticulturists interested in rare and hybrid plants.
